paragraphs.content: Chapter 27
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 27

paragraphs.content: Boast not thyself of to morrow; for thou knowest not what a day may bring forth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Boast not thyself of to morrow; for thou knowest not what a day may bring forth.

paragraphs.content: Let another man praise thee, and not thine own mouth; a stranger, and not thine own lips.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let another man praise thee, and not thine own mouth; a stranger, and not thine own lips.

paragraphs.content: A stone is heavy, and the sand weighty; but a fool’s wrath is heavier than them both.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A stone is heavy, and the sand weighty; but a fool’s wrath is heavier than them both.

paragraphs.content: Wrath is cruel, and anger is outrageous; but who is able to stand before envy?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wrath is cruel, and anger is outrageous; but who is able to stand before envy?

paragraphs.content: Open rebuke is better than secret love.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Open rebuke is better than secret love.

paragraphs.content: Faithful are the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Faithful are the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.

paragraphs.content: The full soul loatheth an honeycomb; but to the hungry soul every bitter thing is sweet.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The full soul loatheth an honeycomb; but to the hungry soul every bitter thing is sweet.

paragraphs.content: As a bird that wandereth from her nest, so is a man that wandereth from his place.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As a bird that wandereth from her nest, so is a man that wandereth from his place.

paragraphs.content: Ointment and perfume rejoice the heart: so doth the sweetness of a man’s friend by hearty counsel.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Ointment and perfume rejoice the heart: so doth the sweetness of a man’s friend by hearty counsel.

paragraphs.content: Thine own friend, and thy father’s friend, forsake not; neither go into thy brother’s house in the day of thy calamity: for better is a neighbour that is near than a brother far off.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thine own friend, and thy father’s friend, forsake not; neither go into thy brother’s house in the day of thy calamity: for better is a neighbour that is near than a brother far off.

paragraphs.content: My son, be wise, and make my heart glad, that I may answer him that reproacheth me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My son, be wise, and make my heart glad, that I may answer him that reproacheth me.

paragraphs.content: A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself; but the simple pass on, and are punished.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself; but the simple pass on, and are punished.

paragraphs.content: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger, and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger, and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.

paragraphs.content: He that blesseth his friend with a loud voice, rising early in the morning, it shall be counted a curse to him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that blesseth his friend with a loud voice, rising early in the morning, it shall be counted a curse to him.

paragraphs.content: A continual dropping in a very rainy day and a contentious woman are alike.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A continual dropping in a very rainy day and a contentious woman are alike.

paragraphs.content: Whosoever hideth her hideth the wind, and the ointment of his right hand, which bewrayeth itself.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whosoever hideth her hideth the wind, and the ointment of his right hand, which bewrayeth itself.

paragraphs.content: Iron sharpeneth iron; so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Iron sharpeneth iron; so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.

paragraphs.content: Whoso keepeth the fig tree shall eat the fruit thereof: so he that waiteth on his master shall be honoured.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whoso keepeth the fig tree shall eat the fruit thereof: so he that waiteth on his master shall be honoured.

paragraphs.content: As in water face answereth to face, so the heart of man to man.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As in water face answereth to face, so the heart of man to man.

paragraphs.content: Hell and destruction are never full; so the eyes of man are never satisfied.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hell and destruction are never full; so the eyes of man are never satisfied.

paragraphs.content: As the fining pot for silver, and the furnace for gold; so is a man to his praise.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As the fining pot for silver, and the furnace for gold; so is a man to his praise.

paragraphs.content: Though thou shouldest bray a fool in a mortar among wheat with a pestle, yet will not his foolishness depart from him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Though thou shouldest bray a fool in a mortar among wheat with a pestle, yet will not his foolishness depart from him.

paragraphs.content: Be thou diligent to know the state of thy flocks, and look well to thy herds.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Be thou diligent to know the state of thy flocks, and look well to thy herds.

paragraphs.content: For riches are not for ever: and doth the crown endure to every generation?
paragraphs.contentHtml: For riches are not for ever: and doth the crown endure to every generation?

paragraphs.content: The hay appeareth, and the tender grass sheweth itself, and herbs of the mountains are gathered.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The hay appeareth, and the tender grass sheweth itself, and herbs of the mountains are gathered.

paragraphs.content: The lambs are for thy clothing, and the goats are the price of the field.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The lambs are for thy clothing, and the goats are the price of the field.

paragraphs.content: And thou shalt have goats’ milk enough for thy food, for the food of thy household, and for the maintenance for thy maidens.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And thou shalt have goats’ milk enough for thy food, for the food of thy household, and for the maintenance for thy maidens.
